meanings.definition: Make a series of soft explosive or spitting sounds.
meanings.sent1: The old car sputters as it struggles to start.
meanings.sent2: The campfire sputters as the damp wood catches fire.
meanings.sent3: The sputters of the coffee machine added a quirky rhythm to the morning routine.
meanings.sent4: His laughter sputters like a broken engine, full of unexpected stops and starts.
meanings.sent5: The sputters of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of light and sound.

meanings.definition: A series of soft explosive or spitting sounds.
meanings.sent1: The engine made loud sputters before finally coming to a stop.
meanings.sent2: The sputters of the frying pan signaled that breakfast was almost ready.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected sputters of the fountain made the park visit more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The sputters of rain on the roof created a soothing lullaby for the night.
meanings.sent5: The sputters of the old record player added a nostalgic charm to the room.

meanings.definition: To speak in a hesitant or faltering manner.
meanings.sent1: She sputters nervously when asked to give a speech.
meanings.sent2: The child sputters through the difficult words of the story.
meanings.sent3: His sputters during the interview made the atmosphere lighter.
meanings.sent4: The politician's sputters failed to convince the audience of his sincerity.
meanings.sent5: Her sputters of apology were sincere but still awkward in the situation.
